knimeNode.name: XLS Control Table Generator
knimeNode.shortDescription: The XLS Control Table Generator node takes an input data table and transforms it to an XLS Control Table, meaning it exchanges the column names to A, B, C, ... and the row IDs to 1, 2, 3, ... just like they would appear when opening the xlsx file in a spreadsheet application. Optionally you can unpivot the table as well to make use of Rule Engine nodes later for flexible and dynamic XLS formatting workflows.

fullDescription.intro:
The XLS Control Table Generator node takes an input data table and transforms it to an XLS Control Table, meaning it exchanges the column names to A, B, C, ... and the row IDs to 1, 2, 3, ... just like they would appear when opening the xlsx file in a spreadsheet application.
Optionally you can unpivot the table as well to make use of Rule Engine nodes later for flexible and dynamic XLS formatting workflows.

tab.name: Shift Rows Option

option.name: use first row as column header

tab.option: Copy the original table's column header to a new first row. This is typically used in line with the corresponding setting in KNIME's Excel Writer node.

tab.name: Result Table Structure Options

option.name: unpivot result table (for easier post-processing and re-pivoting)

tab.option: Unpivot your input table, meaning that each input table cell will become an own output table row. On this basis, own rules can be defined, e.g. to define tags required for many of the XLS Formatting nodes.

Add column headers like the column number, original column names, original row ID, and padded XLS column name. Padding is useful as wide tables will otherwise be difficult to correctly sort, as e.g. Pivoting node's lexicographical sorting option would yield AA, Y, Z order instead of Y, Z, AA (solved via 00Y, 00Z, 0AA).

ports.inPort: Data table, typically holding the raw data of your xlsx sheet.
ports.outPort: The generated XLS Control Table (or its unpivoted version).
